channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Writing in the Margins: Better Inference Pattern for Long Context Retrieval
item.description: In this paper, we introduce Writing in the Margins (WiM), a new inference pattern for Large Language Models designed to optimize the handling of long input sequences in retrieval-oriented tasks.

item.title: Enhancing License Plate Super-Resolution: A Layout-Aware and Character-Driven Approach
item.description: Despite significant advancements in License Plate Recognition (LPR) through deep learning, most improvements rely on high-resolution images with clear characters.

item.title: MTMamba++: Enhancing Multi-Task Dense Scene Understanding via Mamba-Based Decoders
item.description: Multi-task dense scene understanding, which trains a model for multiple dense prediction tasks, has a wide range of application scenarios.

item.title: Force-Guided Bridge Matching for Full-Atom Time-Coarsened Dynamics of Peptides
item.description: Molecular Dynamics (MD) simulations are irreplaceable and ubiquitous in fields of materials science, chemistry, pharmacology just to name a few.

item.title: PAT: Pruning-Aware Tuning for Large Language Models
item.description: Since the model fine-tuning refines the general and chaotic knowledge in pre-trained models, we aim to incorporate structural pruning with the fine-tuning, and propose the Pruning-Aware Tuning (PAT) paradigm to eliminate model redundancy while preserving the model performance to the maximum extend.

item.title: Alfie: Democratising RGBA Image Generation With No $$$
item.description: Designs and artworks are ubiquitous across various creative fields, requiring graphic design skills and dedicated software to create compositions that include many graphical elements, such as logos, icons, symbols, and art scenes, which are integral to visual storytelling.

item.title: Data-Driven Nonlinear Deformation Design of 3D-Printable Shells
item.description: Trained on thousands of physical experiments, our network aids in both forward and inverse design to generate shells exhibiting desired elastoplastic and hyperelastic deformations.

item.title: T-FAKE: Synthesizing Thermal Images for Facial Landmarking
item.description: To facilitate the creation of the dataset, we propose a novel RGB2Thermal loss function, which enables the transfer of thermal style to RGB faces.

item.title: LyCon: Lyrics Reconstruction from the Bag-of-Words Using Large Language Models
item.description: This paper addresses the unique challenge of conducting research in lyric studies, where direct use of lyrics is often restricted due to copyright concerns.

item.title: ERX: A Fast Real-Time Anomaly Detection Algorithm for Hyperspectral Line-Scanning
item.description: Detecting unexpected objects (anomalies) in real-time has great potential for monitoring, managing, and protecting the environment.

item.title: Low-Budget Simulation-Based Inference with Bayesian Neural Networks
item.description: We show that Bayesian neural networks produce informative and well-calibrated posterior estimates with only a few hundred simulations.

item.title: Applying ViT in Generalized Few-shot Semantic Segmentation
item.description: This paper explores the capability of ViT-based models under the generalized few-shot semantic segmentation (GFSS) framework.

item.title: The Mamba in the Llama: Distilling and Accelerating Hybrid Models
item.description: Linear RNN architectures, like Mamba, can be competitive with Transformer models in language modeling while having advantageous deployment characteristics.

item.title: RAW-Adapter: Adapting Pre-trained Visual Model to Camera RAW Images
item.description: sRGB images are now the predominant choice for pre-training visual models in computer vision research, owing to their ease of acquisition and efficient storage.

item.title: DRL-Based Federated Self-Supervised Learning for Task Offloading and Resource Allocation in ISAC-Enabled Vehicle Edge Computing
item.description: Our improved algorithm offloads partial task to RSU and optimizes energy consumption by adjusting transmission power, CPU frequency, and task assignment ratios, balancing local and RSU-based training.

item.title: DIFR3CT: Latent Diffusion for Probabilistic 3D CT Reconstruction from Few Planar X-Rays
item.description: Computed Tomography (CT) scans are the standard-of-care for the visualization and diagnosis of many clinical ailments, and are needed for the treatment planning of external beam radiotherapy.

item.title: Learning Robust Reward Machines from Noisy Labels
item.description: This paper presents PROB-IRM, an approach that learns robust reward machines (RMs) for reinforcement learning (RL) agents from noisy execution traces.

item.title: Revisiting Surgical Instrument Segmentation Without Human Intervention: A Graph Partitioning View
item.description: In this work, we propose an unsupervised method by reframing the video frame segmentation as a graph partitioning problem and regarding image pixels as graph nodes, which is significantly different from the previous efforts.

item.title: GPU-Accelerated Counterfactual Regret Minimization
item.description: Counterfactual regret minimization (CFR) is a family of algorithms of no-regret learning dynamics capable of solving large-scale imperfect information games.

item.title: Drone-assisted Road Gaussian Splatting with Cross-view Uncertainty
item.description: Robust and realistic rendering for large-scale road scenes is essential in autonomous driving simulation.

item.title: Towards Real-world Event-guided Low-light Video Enhancement and Deblurring
item.description: In low-light conditions, capturing videos with frame-based cameras often requires long exposure times, resulting in motion blur and reduced visibility.

item.title: MMASD+: A Novel Dataset for Privacy-Preserving Behavior Analysis of Children with Autism Spectrum Disorder
item.description: This framework achieves an accuracy of 95. 03% for predicting action types and 96. 42% for predicting ASD presence, demonstrating over a 10% improvement compared to models trained on single data modalities.

item.title: Learning effective pruning at initialization from iterative pruning
item.description: To validate the accuracy and generalization of our method, we performed PaI across various models.

item.title: Text2SQL is Not Enough: Unifying AI and Databases with TAG
item.description: Such systems would allow users to leverage the powerful reasoning and knowledge capabilities of language models (LMs) alongside the scalable computational power of data management systems.

item.title: Cross-Modal Temporal Alignment for Event-guided Video Deblurring
item.description: To address this limitation, we aim to solve the video deblurring task by leveraging an event camera with micro-second temporal resolution.

item.title: Platypus: A Generalized Specialist Model for Reading Text in Various Forms
item.description: Recently, generalist models (such as GPT-4V), trained on tremendous data in a unified way, have shown enormous potential in reading text in various scenarios, but with the drawbacks of limited accuracy and low efficiency.

item.title: RSTeller: Scaling Up Visual Language Modeling in Remote Sensing with Rich Linguistic Semantics from Openly Available Data and Large Language Models
item.description: Abundant, well-annotated multimodal data in remote sensing are pivotal for aligning complex visual remote sensing (RS) scenes with human language, enabling the development of specialized vision language models across diverse RS interpretation tasks.

item.title: Empowering Sign Language Communication: Integrating Sentiment and Semantics for Facial Expression Synthesis
item.description: Facial expressions (non-manual), in particular, are responsible for encoding the grammar of the sentence to be spoken, applying punctuation, pronouns, or emphasizing signs.

item.title: Hierarchical Graph Interaction Transformer with Dynamic Token Clustering for Camouflaged Object Detection
item.description: In this paper, we propose a hierarchical graph interaction network termed HGINet for camouflaged object detection, which is capable of discovering imperceptible objects via effective graph interaction among the hierarchical tokenized features.

item.title: SAM & SAM 2 in 3D Slicer: SegmentWithSAM Extension for Annotating Medical Images
item.description: In this paper, we adapt this model to the annotation of 3D medical images and offer our implementation in the form of an extension to the popular annotation software: 3D Slicer.

item.title: No Regrets: Investigating and Improving Regret Approximations for Curriculum Discovery
item.description: Based on this, we instead directly train on levels with high learnability and find that this simple and intuitive approach outperforms UED methods and DR in several binary-outcome environments, including on our domain and the standard UED domain of Minigrid.

item.title: OctFusion: Octree-based Diffusion Models for 3D Shape Generation
item.description: Diffusion models have emerged as a popular method for 3D generation.

item.title: Re-Mix: Optimizing Data Mixtures for Large Scale Imitation Learning
item.description: Increasingly large imitation learning datasets are being collected with the goal of training foundation models for robotics.

item.title: A Lightweight Insulator Defect Detection Model Based on Drone Images
item.description: Initially, the backbone network of IDD-YOLO employs GhostNet for feature extraction.

item.title: Revisiting Image Captioning Training Paradigm via Direct CLIP-based Optimization
item.description: However, when attempting to optimize modern and higher-quality metrics like CLIP-Score and PAC-Score, this training method often encounters instability and fails to acquire the genuine descriptive capabilities needed to produce fluent and informative captions.

item.title: A Practitioner's Guide to Continual Multimodal Pretraining
item.description: In this work, we complement current perspectives on continual pretraining through a research test bed as well as provide comprehensive guidance for effective continual model updates in such scenarios.

item.title: SWE-bench-java: A GitHub Issue Resolving Benchmark for Java
item.description: GitHub issue resolving is a critical task in software engineering, recently gaining significant attention in both industry and academia.

item.title: Probing Causality Manipulation of Large Language Models
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have shown various ability on natural language processing, including problems about causality.

item.title: Learning Tree-Structured Composition of Data Augmentation
item.description: Existing augmentation methods such as RandAugment randomly sample from a list of pre-selected transformations, while methods such as AutoAugment apply advanced search to optimize over an augmentation set of size $k^d$, which is the number of transformation sequences of length $d$, given a list of $k$ transformations.

item.title: CURLoRA: Stable LLM Continual Fine-Tuning and Catastrophic Forgetting Mitigation
item.description: Our method addresses two critical challenges in LLM fine-tuning: mitigating catastrophic forgetting during continual learning and reducing the number of trainable parameters.

item.title: Comparative Analysis: Violence Recognition from Videos using Transfer Learning
item.description: Action recognition has become a hot topic in computer vision.

item.title: Theoretical Proportion Label Perturbation for Learning from Label Proportions in Large Bags
item.description: In our method, smaller bags (mini-bags) are generated by sampling instances from large-sized bags (original bags), and these mini-bags are used in place of the original bags.

item.title: Federated User Preference Modeling for Privacy-Preserving Cross-Domain Recommendation
item.description: Additionally, they transfer differentially private user-item interaction matrices or embeddings across domains to protect privacy.

item.title: DynaSurfGS: Dynamic Surface Reconstruction with Planar-based Gaussian Splatting
item.description: Extensive experiments demonstrate that DynaSurfGS surpasses state-of-the-art methods in both high-fidelity surface reconstruction and photorealistic rendering.

item.title: A Synthetic Benchmark to Explore Limitations of Localized Drift Detections
item.description: Concept drift is a common phenomenon in data streams where the statistical properties of the target variable change over time.

item.title: Dual-Path Adversarial Lifting for Domain Shift Correction in Online Test-time Adaptation
item.description: Specifically, we introduce an extra token, referred to as \textit{domain shift token}, at each layer of the transformer network.

item.title: Uncovering Knowledge Gaps in Radiology Report Generation Models through Knowledge Graphs
item.description: Recent advancements in artificial intelligence have significantly improved the automatic generation of radiology reports.

item.title: Automated Machine Learning in Insurance
item.description: Automated Machine Learning (AutoML) aims to automatically complete the full life-cycle of ML tasks and provides state-of-the-art ML models without human intervention or supervision.

item.title: I2EBench: A Comprehensive Benchmark for Instruction-based Image Editing
item.description: We will open-source I2EBench, including all instructions, input images, human annotations, edited images from all evaluated methods, and a simple script for evaluating the results from new IIE models.

item.title: Self-supervised Speech Representations Still Struggle with African American Vernacular English
item.description: Underperformance of ASR systems for speakers of African American Vernacular English (AAVE) and other marginalized language varieties is a well-documented phenomenon, and one that reinforces the stigmatization of these varieties.
